title: Why Riot will keep nerfing "shit" around the LCS
body:
Like with Poppy or Nidalee. The LCS is nothing but a precursor to the SoloQ to follow. People bitch when Graves ends up OP for a patch or two but don't realize that Riot nerfing around the LCS is to prevent just that. Nerfing Support Malz before it becomes too much oppressive cancer, nerfing Vlad before he dominated SoloQ for free last year.

Yes the Malz nerfs were warranted. This is from somebody with 80k mastery on him and 450 Malz games before mastery existed. The rework was a failure and like Azir, Aatrox or Kalista he has to be guttered until fixed. Does it make me sad? Yes. Is it unreasonable? No.

Now are there special immunity cases of bias? Maybe, but believe it or not Riven is not used in the LCS other than a situational pick in S3-4 and I am pretty sure Yasuo never has been(may be wrong). Lee might see some favoritism we have that one quote people take out of context where they don't like nerfing him out of meta because he makes for good show. But I ain't gettin' into that.

But no sorry. Riot should always balance around the best players playing the champions in the ideal way with good team cordination, with adjustments for Bronze-Plat only if champions get way out of hand(See Yi last time he was viable). Because no other form of balancing makes sense.

If a champion pubstomps low tier soloQ because they are strong in LCS it is fine for a brief period to see if people learn how to beat them. Otherwise it is most likely they are a binary design that is too easy to succeed with when strong in low tier, but require being that strong for high tier. In otherwords rework material.

Funny how the OP champs from LCS end up plaguing SoloQ a month later and people bitch "It's been OP for AGES how did you not see when Bergfakerdoublehai picked it!" But then when Riot does the appropriate thing and nips it in the bud before the sheep catch on "OMFG nurf muh champ fur ur money make lcs!?!?!"

Sorry. If something as binary as Malzahar is being oppressively dull in LCS to too large of a success. It will find a way to be oppressive in SoloQ within a month. Deserves nerfs.

If you'd rather balance for Bronze-Plat however, brace for the Riven buffs as she performs badly below Diamond.

> But no sorry. Riot should always balance around the best players playing the champions in the ideal way with good team cordination, with adjustments for Bronze-Plat only if champions get way out of hand(See Yi last time he was viable). Because no other form of balancing makes sense.

Wrong again. Another equally valid way of balancing is the MvC2 method - make them all broken, if something is too crazy ban it. There is no reason to make things unplayable for everyone if the problem is ultra-high-level competitive game balancing.

I mean, it's a continuous cycle of:
Pro players abuse unbalanced shit -> Rito nerfs said shit -> Pro players abuse unbalanced shit.

And this all inherently comes down to Counterplay and Reliability.

Pro Players would rather take something that gets a kill 100% of the time than the thing that sometimes gets 2 kills but only 50% of the time.
Only in a utopian world where everything has equal measures of counterplay (regardless of how much), would this be balanced, or in a system like Overwatch where you are free to change characters in-game, so counter-picking BECOMES a/the form of counterplay.

The former would at best be achieved in the future once every unbalanced/low counterplay/toxic/nicheless are all successfully reworked and balanced, and the latter is not viable in a game such as league (at least without changing much of what makes League, League).

***THAT BEING SAID***

Riot having favourites ({{champion:64}}) is completely biased.
Lee at his core is balanced, but with all the extra crap loaded on (ward hopping, lifesteal/spellvamp, no bad way to use his ult, tiny cooldown on his ult, huge ratio/scaling on his ult, root on his ult so the target cannot change the trajectory, 350 ms, 3 second duration on Q mark, Q cooldown starting on 1st cast rather than second), he becomes this champion that simply feels like total bullshit.
There is PLENTY to nerf about Lee Sin that Riot won't because they are scared he wont be played in pro play.

So to an extent I agree with the general pleb-cries of: "fuk u 4 balancing around LC$", because it is not consistent as long as they are playing favourites, but at the same time I know it's unreasonable to expect that anything but pro play dictates balance, at least as long as it exists.
If they balance around lcs then why we 55% champions picked vs 80% champions picked in dota2? They balance their game around pro scene too.
That's idiotic. Gutting a champion doesn't ensure they will be fixed. It's a terrible solution.

Don't forget Riot trashing champs and not touching them, destroying the playerbase of a champ for X amount of time (just look at Yorick and Mord). Yes, people will bring up that they did get updates and whatnot, but there are still so many issues with them. If Riot actually followed up with these champs, then I think we would get much fewer salty threads.

I for one wish Riot would actually do something for the _literal hundreds_ of bugs that Mord has but they just continue side stepping him like he doesn't exist. It's extremely upsetting as a player to have the devs not caring about parts of their game that is evolving like it is. 

I guess I have to wait another 3+ years for Riot to even touch those two champs and maybe place them in a better spot.

Half the thing they do in LCS does not work in teams with lack of coordination, like standard Solo Q.

Also, things like Malz support are not a problem itself, but a symptom of a bigger issue.

The strength of a champion is very superficial in solo queue especially on western servers.  General mechanics and decision making can enable a "one trick" of any champion to reach rank 1.   When the top tiers on a server have such good fundamentals that champion strength is a real limiting factor,   then the niceties of stats and kits will become meaningful.  That said,   ADC battle raka would be able to make rank 1 NA in the hands of a super computer or serious, disciplined player.

I think the main argument here is that they balance around team play and solo performance has become more and more irrelevant throughout the years. So if Malzahar is broken in perfectly coordinating, premade 5v5 compositions then yeah, he is broken in that manner.

In SoloQ, fuck no. He's weak enough as it is on his own and his trusty random Adc partner. It's not like we can become premade with randoms.
